results.title: Show me English: a visit to hospital [episode 4]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants to communicate in everyday situations. The receptionist at a large hospital gives directions to Tina on how to find the Pathology Department. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show business
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Eddie Cantor and Edwin Marin
results.brief_description: Show business follows the fortunes of a small group of stage folk from 1914 to 1929 and is based on incidents from Eddie Cantor’s life. Features scenes from a variety of performers including minstrel shows, vaudeville, Grand Opera and Ziegfeld Follies. Songs include “You may not remenber me”, “It had to be you” and “Whoopee” Cast includes Eddie Cantor, Joan Davis, George Murphy and Constance Moore. Story by Bert Granet.

results.title: Show Boat
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and George Sidney
results.brief_description: The 1951 MGM film of the great stage musical, based on the 1926 novel by Edna Ferber, is a charming, beautiful entertainment with an endearing cast, including Kathryn Grayson as Magnolia, Howard Keel as the gambler, Gaylord Ravenal, and Ava Gardner, nominated for an Academy Award, as the tragic Julie Laverne.

results.title: Shout! the story of Johnny O'keefe
results.brief_description: Johnny O’Keefe, the man who almost single-handedly created the Australian rock`n’roll industry. The man who challenged the Americans and broke all the rules, and whose reward was the devotion of millions of fans for a generation. This is the true story - all the triumphs and all the tears that drove the man forward and ultimately to his tragic, untimely death in 1978. A must for everyone who was there.

results.title: Shout it out numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animated geometric shapes and music to illustrate numbers from one to ten. Triangles, circles, and squares transform into animals, trains, suns, see-saws and other familiar objects.

results.title: Should you drink?
results.brief_description: Eplains the importance of each individual making an honest and intelligent decision about the use of alcohol. From the series “Health for effective living”.

results.title: Shotput
results.brief_description: Basic techniques have changed over time in relation to shotput. Action shots broken down into steps show correct use of body tension to maximise throws. Good quality instruction film.

results.title: Shortspell
results.creator_credit: Kinetic Film Enterprises and Stuart Wynn Jones
results.brief_description: An animated review of the alphabet in which each letter becomes a picture and each picture becomes the next letter. Both sound and picture are drawn directly onto the film by the artist.

results.title: Short vision
results.creator_credit: BFI, Joan Foldes and Peter Foldes
results.brief_description: An experimental film: using a simple animation technique “A SHORT VISION” creates an imaginative and disturbing picture of atomic warfare. A “thing” suddenly appears in the sky, flying over countryside and cities and destroying all living things. All that finally remains is a single flame with a moth fluttering around it; and, after a moment, the flame devours the moth. Music by Matyas Seiber.

results.title: Short tall story
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and John Halas
results.brief_description: Charming allegorical film about the role of the United Nations in resolving disputes: Separated by a bank of cloud, the short people and tall people are becoming increasingly ill-disposed to each other. Failing to resolve the dispute on their own, the U.N. Fairy is enlisted to their aid, and the cloud dividing the conflicting parties are driven aside.
